info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued August 08 at 2:34PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... Oregon Department of Environmental Quality has issued an Air Pollution Advisory...in effect until further notice. The Oregon Department of Environmental Quality expects intermittent smoke from wildfires burning in the region combined with forecasted weather conditions. This will cause air quality levels to fluctuate and could be at unhealthy levels, especially over the northern half of Klamath and Lake Counties. Smoke levels can change rapidly depending on the weather. People most at risk include infants and young children, people with heart or lung disease, older adults and pregnant people. Members of sensitive groups may experience health effects. The general public is not likely to be affected. Protect yourself and family members when smoke levels are high. - Stay inside if possible and keep windows and doors closed. - Avoid strenuous activity. - Use high efficiency particulate air (HEPA) filters. - When air quality improves to moderate or healthy, open windows and doors to air out homes and businesses. - Cloth, dust and surgical masks do not protect you from harmful particles in smoke. Use approved respirators. For additional information...please visit the web site at http://www.oregon.gov/deq
